contentList.content: Unleash special magical effects with some of your shots.
You have studied a unique and cursed method of archery that weaves blood into attacks to produce supernatural effects.
Blood Archers stand watch, guarding their own againtst trespassers and using blood-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can cause harm.
You can use the Blood Shot feature.

You infuse fey blood into this arrow to temporarily charm its target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra [1], and must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or attack the creature closest to them (other than you), even if it's allied.

Infuse your arrow with fiendish blood. The arrow detonates, igniting blood in a [1] radius around the target. All creatures in this area take [2], ignoring <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistance</LSTag> to fire.

When this arrow strikes its target, blood tainted by oozes creates grasping and sharp tendrils of blood, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the arrow takes [2], and its speed is reduced by [1]. If the target moves 1 foot or more without teleporting, it takes an additional [2] acid damage the first time on each of its turns.

You use celestial blood to try to temporarily banish your target to the Celestial Plane. The creature must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or be banished and incapacitated for 1 turn.

Using ancient bestial blood, you grant your arrow the ability to seek and hunt any foe, allowing the arrow to curve and twist its path in search of its prey. On impact, the creature must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or take an additional [1], and you always know its location.

Shadows infused with blood swirl around the arrow’s target. The creature takes [1], and <LSTag Tooltip="Status" Type="Darkness">darkness</LSTag> obscures the area within a [2] radius until the end of your next turn

You harness the blood of giants, causing the arrow to explode with thunderous force. The target takes [1] and is pushed back [2]. The target must also succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Strength Saving Throw</LSTag> or be knocked <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.

You imbue your arrow with cursed undead blood inflicting [1]. The target must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LSTag> on weapon <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attacks</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.
The creature has movement speed reduced by [2] and takes [1] when it moves.
The creature has movement speed reduced by [2] and takes [1] when it moves.
The creature has movement speed reduced by [2] and takes [1] when it moves.
The creature has movement speed reduced by [2] and takes [1] when it moves.

You learn to unleash special magical effects with with some of your shots. Once per turn when you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Blood Shot options to that arrow.

The target or any creature within reach can use its action to make a <LSTag Tooltip="SkillCheck">Strength (Athletics)</LSTag> check against your <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Spell Save DC</LSTag>. On a success, the tendrils are removed. Otherwise, the tendrils last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.

You transform your arrow into a sharp shard of blood. Instead of an attack roll, the arrow fires in a line 30 feet long and 10 feet wide, passing through creatures and objects in its path. Each creature must make a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Dexterity Saving Throw</LSTag> against your <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Spell Save DC</LSTag>. On a failed save, the creature takes [1]. On a success, they take half as much.

Using ancient bestial blood, you grant your arrow the ability to seek and hunt any foe, allowing the arrow to curve and twist its path in search of its prey. On impact, the creature must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or take an additional [1], and you always know its location.

You gain the ability to infuse arrows with magic. While you fire a nonmagical arrow from a shortbow or longbow, it becomes magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity you can add your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier to the damage roll, the magic then fades. In addition once per turn, when you use your Blood Shot feature, you can add your Constitution modifier to the damage roll of the effect.

You learn how to recall your arrows. When you make an attack roll with a blood arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against the original target, as the arrow flies back towards you.
Use your bonus action to reroll the attack roll againt a different target within [1] of the original target.

You infuse fey blood into this arrow to temporarily charm its target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra [1], and must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or attack the creature closest to them (other than you), even if it's allied.

You infuse fey blood into this arrow to temporarily charm its target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra [1], and you choose one of its allies within 30 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or consider this ally as an enemy until the start of your next turn.

You can choose to sacrifice your litetorce to reinvigorate control over your blood magic. You take [1], which you cannot reduce in any way, and regain 1d4 uses of your Blood Shot.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> modifier. Replenished by a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

You infuse fey blood into this arrow to temporarily charm its target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra [1], and must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CONFUSION">Confused</LSTag>.

Infuse your arrow with fiendish blood. The arrow detonates, igniting blood in a [1] radius around the target. All creatures in this area take [2], ignoring <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistance</LSTag> to fire.
When precision matters most, a missed arrow need not mean failure. If you miss an attack roll with an arrow, you can use a bonus action to immediately make another attack against the same target
Your body adapts to the tarblood within. You are immune to disease, are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to poison damage.
You take necrotic damage equal to [1] modifier, which you cannot reduce in any way, and regain 1d4 uses of your Blood Shot.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag> made with weapons.
You have studied a unique and cursed method of archery that weaves blood into attacks to produce supernatural effects.
You have studied a unique and cursed method of archery that weaves blood into attacks to produce supernatural effects.
Create a blood arrow with your blood and hurl it at your enemy.
